page.title: 14Ecology of Cotswolds (2)
page.content: The trees and meadows shield birds such as pheasants,woodcock.This also includes birds of preys from sparrow hawks to barn owls. This mixture of trees and grass also gives coverage to many mice and other rodents including squirrels,foxes,mice and badgers. There are many species of butterflies though these are being affected by modern crop sprays and weedkillers used within the area.These sprays effect the butterflies food chains and this proves to be a public concern. "Super Rabbits" at Painswick have been digging up residents gardens and the local golf course.The rabbits have been breeding from February to late autumn,residents of Painswick say the rabbits are the size of hares!.
